abstract: Most partners at Forstmann Little, the pioneering private equity firm started in 1978 by Theodore J. Forstmann and his brother, continue to work in the industry.
snippet: Most partners at Forstmann Little, the pioneering private equity firm started in 1978 by Theodore J. Forstmann and his brother, continue to work in the industry.
lead_paragraph: Two newspapers have paid advertisements on Tuesday honoring the memory of Theodore J. Forstmann, the colorful Wall Street deal maker who died of brain cancer on Sunday. The New York Times has a quarter-page ad from JPMorgan Chase that reads “More than a valued client. More than a great partner. Our dear friend. In Memoriam Theodore J. Fortsmann.”
